revision.text:
{{Infobox aircraft occurrence |occurrence_type = Accident |name = All Nippon Airways Flight 58
JASDF 92-7932 |date = 30 July 1971 |type = [[Mid-air collision]] |outcome = Collision |site = near [[Shizukuishi, Iwate|Shizukuishi]], [[Japan]] |total_injuries = 1 |total_fatalities = 162 (all on board Flight 58) |total_survivors = 1 | plane1_image = All Nippon Airways Boeing 727-281 (JA8343 881 20572) (7855381336).jpg | plane1_alt = | plane1_caption = An [[All Nippon Airways|ANA]] Boeing 727 similar to the accident aircraft |plane1_type = [[Boeing 727|Boeing 727-281]] |plane1_operator = [[All Nippon Airways]] |plane1_tailnum = JA8329 |plane1_origin = [[Sapporo-Chitose Airport]] (CTS/RJCC) |plane1_destination= [[Tokyo-Haneda Airport]] (HND/RJTT) |plane1_passengers = 155 |plane1_crew = 7 |plane1_injuries = 0 |plane1_fatalities = 162 (all) |plane1_survivors = 0 | plane2_image = JASDF F-86F（62-7527）.JPG | plane2_alt = | plane2_caption = A preserved JASDF F-86F on display at JASDF base Nara |plane2_type = [[North American F-86 Sabre|Mitsubishi F-86F Sabre]] |plane2_operator = [[Japan Air Self-Defense Force|JASDF]] |plane2_tailnum = 92-7932 |plane2_passengers = 0 |plane2_crew = 1 |plane2_injuries = 1 |plane2_fatalities = 0 |plane2_survivors = 1 (all) }} '''All Nippon Airways (ANA) Flight 58''' was a Japanese domestic flight from [[Sapporo]] to Tokyo, operated by [[All Nippon Airways]] (ANA). On 30 July 1971, at 2:04 local time, a [[Japan Air Self-Defense Force]] (JASDF) jet fighter collided with the [[Boeing 727]] airliner operating the flight, causing both aircraft to crash.Sekigawa, Eiichiro, "''Mitsubishi's Mentor... ...Supersonics from Nagoya''", AIR International, April 1975, Volume 8, Number 4, page 172."''161 Die In Worst Aviation Disaster''", The Coshocton (Ohio) Tribune, July 30, 1971, page 1 All 162 occupants of the flight were killed, while the Sabre pilot, a trainee with the JASDF, ejected before the collision and survived. ==Aircraft== The ANA airliner was a [[Boeing 727|Boeing 727-281]]The aircraft was a Boeing 727-200 model; Boeing assigns a unique code for each company that buys one of its aircraft, which is applied as an [[infix]] to the model number at the time the aircraft is built; All Nippon's code is ''81'', hence "727-281". with [[Aircraft registration|registration]] {{Airreg|JA|8329}}; it was less than six months old at the time of the accident.{{cite web|url=http://aviation-safety.net/database/record.php?id=19710730-1 |title=Accident description, ANA Boeing 727-281 JA8329 near Shizukuishi, Japan |website=aviation-safety.net |publisher=[[Flight Safety Foundation]] |access-date=16 July 2016}} The JASDF aircraft was a [[North American F-86 Sabre|Mitsubishi F-86F Sabre]], a Japanese-built version of North American Aviation's famous jet fighter, with tail number 92-7932. Japan, prohibited from making its own combat aircraft after its defeat in [[World War II]], used and continues to use [[United States|U.S.]]-licensed planes instead; at the time of the accident, the F-86F was one of the primary aircraft in the JASDF's inventory. ==Sequence of events== ANA Flight 58 departed [[Chitose Air Base|Chitose Airport]] in the small city of [[Chitose, Hokkaido|Chitose]] near Sapporo, with 155 passengers and a crew of 7 on board for a domestic flight to Tokyo's [[Haneda International Airport]]. After takeoff, the aircraft climbed to its cruising altitude of about {{convert|28000|ft|m}}. Meanwhile, a 22-year-old JASDF trainee pilot, {{nihongo|Yoshimi Ichikawa|市川良美|''Ichikawa Yoshimi''}}, and his instructor were practicing [[air combat manoeuvring]] in their Sabres near Morioka, northern [[Honshū]]. Ichikawa, who had not been watching for air traffic, was told by his instructor to break away from Flight 58 as it approached and banked left to avoid it, but it was already too late and he [[Ejection seat|ejected]] from his aircraft. Moments later, the leading edge of the Sabre's right wing struck the Boeing's left [[tailplane]] at an altitude of {{convert|26000|ft}}. The damage to the Boeing's tail caused it to go out of control; it entered a steep dive and disintegrated in mid-air, with the wreckage impacting near the town of [[Shizukuishi]]. All 162 passengers and crew were killed. The Sabre, having lost its right wing, plunged into a nearby rice paddy."{{cite news| url = http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,903063,00.html | title = Disasters: The Worst Ever | magazine = [[TIME]] | date = 9 August 1971 | accessdate =27 November 2009}} Most of the passengers came from [[Fuji, Shizuoka|Fuji]] in [[Shizuoka Prefecture]] and were returning from a trip to Hokkaido. Of the passengers, 125 were in a tour group made up of members of a society for relatives of Japanese servicemen killed in World War II.朝日新聞1971年8月1日”Asahi Shinbun August 1, 1971” The pilot of Flight 58, Saburo Kawanishi, 41, had more than 8,000 hours of flying experience. He was able to transmit a brief radio message between the time of the collision and the aircraft's disintegration.Simpson (2014), Part 1 Ichikawa was later tried and acquitted on a charge of involuntary manslaughter.{{cite web|url=http://www.history.com/this-day-in-history/fighter-jet-collides-with-passenger-plane |title=THIS DAY IN HISTORY: JUL 30; Fighter jet collides with passenger plane, 1971 |website=www.history.com |publisher=[[A&E Television Networks]] |access-date=16 July 2016}} The loss of Flight 58 was the deadliest air disaster at the time, surpassing the crash of [[Viasa Flight 742]] in 1969, and remained so until the crash of [[Aeroflot Flight 217]] thirteen months later. It remains the deadliest accident suffered by All Nippon Airways, the second-deadliest involving a Boeing 727 behind [[Mexicana Flight 940]], and the third-deadliest on Japanese soil behind [[China Airlines Flight 140]] and [[Japan Airlines Flight 123]]. ==Notes== {{reflist|group=note}} == References == {{reflist}} * {{cite book|last=Simpson |first=Paul |title=The Mammoth Book of Air Disasters and Near Misses |year=2014 |publisher=Robinson |location=London |isbn=978-1-78033-828-6}} ==External links== {{Portal|Japan|Aviation|1970s|Disasters|Military history|Death}} * "[http://www.mlit.go.jp/hakusyo/transport/shouwa47/ind100206/frame.html 昭和47年度 運輸白書 - III 航空 第2章 航空事故 - 運輸省]." {{Coord|39|41|N|140|59|E|region:JP-03_type:landmark|display=title}} {{All Nippon Airways}} {{Aviation accidents and incidents in 1971}} [[Category:1971 in Japan]] [[Category:Aviation accidents and incidents in 1971]] [[Category:Aviation accidents and incidents in Japan]] [[Category:Accidents and incidents involving the Boeing 727]] [[Category:Mid-air collisions]] [[Category:Airliner accidents and incidents involving mid-air collisions]] [[Category:All Nippon Airways accidents and incidents]] [[Category:Accidents and incidents involving military aircraft]] [[Category:Airliner accidents and incidents caused by pilot error]]
